sentences.english: Don't act so foolishly, John. Come to your senses.
sentences.chinese: 別醜態百出啦，約翰，放理智點。

sentences.english: John made a poor figure at the meeting.
Although she felt that she was being very fashionable, she appeared utterly ridiculous in the outfit.
sentences.chinese: 雖然她自覺非常時髦，但是那身打扮令她醜態百出。

sentences.english: He got drunk and made a spectacle of himself in the club.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪在昨晚聚會上喝得酩酊大醉，醜態百出。

sentences.english: They are made either to fall on their backs or go down on their knees begging for mercy.
sentences.chinese: 他們被打敗後跪在地上求饒，醜態百出。

definition: hard to distinguish real from imitation
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
